result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy Lee Degner Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 11:36 AM Defendant Randy Lee Degner in court, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Randy Lee Degner appeared by video means.  Cases called 14CF169, 14CF313 and 15CF82.  Court has reviewed the file and Defendant's letter/brief.  Statements by the Court.  Courts review indicates that bond was never set 15CF82, cash bond set 14CF313 and signature bond set in 14CF169.  Statements by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Statements by the Court.  Court denies motion for sentence credit and has already awarded credit on this sentence.  Defendant questions Court regarding decision.  Responses by Atty Bayne-Allison.

02:02 PM Defendant Randy Lee Degner in court, in custody via video conference.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 14CF313, 14CF169 and 15CF82.  Statements by Atty Bayne-Allison regarding status.  Clerk was not able to locate signed bond.  Statements by Defendant.  Statements by the Court.  Court needs more time to review Defendant's letter and brief that was attached to letter.  Decision scheduled for May 6, 2019 at 11:20 am.
Motion hearing on April 3, 2019 at 02:00 pm.

08:50 AM Defendant Randy Lee Degner in court, in custody via telephone conference.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called 14CF169, 14CF313 and 15CF82.  Statements by Atty Bayne-Allison - Defendant's motion to amend sentence credit in 15CF82.  Statements by the Court - video connection issues.  Court can't login to system and Clerk is unable to locate record needed for motion on sentence credit.  Statements by Atty Bayne-Allison - Clerk's office needs to locate bond set on or about 10/26/15.  Statements by Defendant regarding bond revoked on 10/23.  Responses by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Responses by Defendant.  Statements by the Court.  Defendant's release date is 8/24/21.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 3, 2019 at 02:00 pm.

Motion hearing on March 21, 2019 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Randy Lee Degner in court, in custody, via video conference.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 14CF169, 14CF313 and 15CF82.  Statements by Atty Bayne-Allison regarding Defendant's correspondence provided to the Court.  State feels this is not a sufficient motion.  State requests Court deny Defendant's motion.  Court addresses Defendant.  Court requires Defendant submit a proper motion to address jail credit.  Right to counsel - Court instructs Defendant to contact public defender.  Statements by Defendant.  Statements by the Court.  Statements by Atty Bayne-Allison.

Hearing on December 5, 2018 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Statement as to negotiated plea
(2) separate forms

Defendant Randy Lee Degner in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
14CF313 - Plea no contest to counts 1,5,6 - Counts 2,3,4 DRI
14CF169 - Plea no contest to count 2 - Counts 1,3,4 DRI
15CF82 - Plea no contest to cunt 1 - Counts 2, 3 DRI
Voting rights/Firearm possession and citizenship advised
Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis eixsts for plea - Found guilty by court - 
Arguments by Dunphy/Goetz/Court to sentencing - 
14CF313 - Counts 1,5,6 - Joint Recommendation - 60 months initial confinement each count concurrent with 24 months extended supervision
14CF169 - Count 2 - Joint Recommendation - 12 months initial confinement - 12 months extended supervision
15CF82 - Count 1 - Joint Recommendation - 60 months initial confinement - 24 months extended supervision
These cases will run concurrent to any other sentences currently serving - DNA sample - 
Costs/surcharges on each count - Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by agent - Voting rights given - 
Defendant is eligible for programs (Department has final say on programs) - Bond applied to costs and balance to be refunded to person that posted - Post conviction rights given - Jail credit to be determined
